bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 56 (Tuesday, March 28, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. CALVERT:H.R. 1820.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 18 AND Article IV, Section 3,Clause 2 of the U.S. ConstitutionThe single subject of this legislation is:The single subject of this bill is to exempt a localrecreational airport, located on Army Corp property, from aCorp policy which would then allow the Corp to renew thelease with the City of Corona which expires in in 2036.[Page H1528]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Aviation.
Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

summary.text:
This bill requires the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers (USACE) to renew the City of Corona, California's lease of land to operate the Corona Municipal Airport. The bill further prohibits the USACE from applying the March 30, 2009, recreation development policy for water resource development projects to the lease.

The Corona Municipal Airport is located within the Prado Flood Control Basin Project Area. The City of Corona operates the airport and leases the land from the USACE.

bill.title: To require the Secretary of the Army to renew the lease of land for operations of the Corona Municipal Airport, and for other purposes.

item.title: To require the Secretary of the Army to renew the lease of land for operations of the Corona Municipal Airport, and for other purposes.
To require the Secretary of the Army to renew the lease of land for operations of the Corona Municipal Airport, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Aviation.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
